axes.name: Economic Left ↔ Right
axes.description: Taxation, redistribution, and social spending. Left: Progressive taxation, expanded social services. Right: Low taxation, minimal state intervention, market-led growth.

axes.name: State Control ↔ Market Economics
axes.description: Role of the state in the economy. Left: State ownership of key utilities, active regulation. Right: Privatisation, deregulation, private sector leadership.

axes.name: Land & Property Rights
axes.description: Land expropriation, communal rights, and land reform pace. Left: Expropriation without compensation, communal precedence. Right: Market-rate transactions, private property rights, commercial agriculture.

axes.name: Labour Rights ↔ Market Flexibility
axes.description: Union power, minimum wages, and labour regulation. Left: Strong unionisation, wage floors, job protection. Right: Labour flexibility, minimal restrictions, lower wage floors.

axes.name: Law & Order ↔ Civil Liberties
axes.description: State authority, policing, and protest. Left: Civil liberties prioritised, protest rights, scrutiny of state power. Right: Strong policing, order prioritised, limits on disruptive protest.

axes.name: Institutional Independence & Governance
axes.description: Independence of judiciary, electoral bodies, and oversight. Strong support for institutional autonomy, anti-corruption, good governance vs. political executive flexibility.

axes.name: Environmental Protection ↔ Energy Pragmatism
axes.description: Climate action and energy transition speed. Left: Aggressive climate targets, rapid renewable transition, restrictions on fossil fuels. Right: Pragmatic energy mix, coal flexibility, economic prioritisation.

axes.name: Social Progressivism ↔ Conservatism
axes.description: LGBTQ+ rights, gender equality, and cultural liberalism. Left: Active promotion of progressive values. Right: Traditional/conservative values, minimal state intervention in social morality.

axes.name: Global Integration ↔ Economic Nationalism
axes.description: Trade openness, international integration, and immigration. Left: Global cooperation, open borders, multilateral engagement. Right: Economic nationalism, border control, protectionism.

axes.name: Radical Transformation ↔ Incremental Reform
axes.description: Speed and depth of systemic change. Left: Radical, rapid transformation addressing historical injustices. Right: Continuity, incremental reform, stability-focused.

axes.name: Public Urban Planning ↔ Market-Led Development
axes.description: Urban form and transit priorities. Left: Public transport, mixed-use walkability, affordable housing. Right: Car-friendly, private property rights, market-led sprawl.

axes.name: Affirmative Action & BEE ↔ Meritocratic Neutrality
axes.description: Employment equity, BEE, and targeted economic support. Left: Active targeting to address inequality, protected minorities. Right: Minimal state-mandated targets, colour-blind approaches.
